required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A First-ever Research Collaboration to Neural Flexibility Development in Chinese Infants and Toddlers
clinical_study.official_title: A First-ever Research Collaboration to Neural Flexibility Development in Chinese Infants and Toddlers

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective is to characterize neurocognitive developmental characteristics among Chinese infants and toddlers (1.5 months to 2 years of age) assessed using MRI. This is an observational study to learn and help describe the cognitive development characteristics of Chinese children.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational study with accelerated, longitudinal, sequential design including 2 structured sub-cohorts with different baseline age ranges enrolling at the same time (enrolment window at age 1.5-6 months [42-182 days] and 9-15 months [274-456 days], respectively), and will undergo both MRI and behavioural assessment at enrolment and 8 months later. The study includes an optional voluntary visit at 3 years of age (1095 days) to assess cognitive functions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Neural flexibility is a quantitative measure of the frequency at which brain regions change their allegiance from one functional module to another during a given time period. It will be measured by MRI at the brain regions implicated to be associated with cognitive flexibility (including anterior cingulate cortex, dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, ventrolateral prefrontal cortex, anterior insula, interior frontal junction, superior parietal lobule, precuneus, intraparietal sulcus, frontal eye fields, and temporoparietal junction)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Brain structure (brain regions volume) measured using MRI, including the hippocampal and frontal lobe volume (in cubic millimeter)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Brain structure (cortical surface area) measured using MRI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Brain structure (cortical thickness) measured using MRI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Brain functional network topologies of the nine commonly assessed brain functional networks, including the primary visual, secondary visual, visual association, motosensory, default mode, frontoparietal, medial frontal, subcortical and cerebellum networks using MRI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Brain functional connection strengths of the nine commonly assessed brain functional networks, including the primary visual, secondary visual, visual association, motosensory, default mode, frontoparietal, medial frontal, subcortical and cerebellum networks using MRI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Using the Griffiths Mental Development Scales for China (GDS-C). Gross and fine motor, personal-social-emotional, language and communication and learning development will be assessed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Using an established eye tracking protocol in Chinese pediatric population (using the Tobii TX300 eye tracker)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Using the Infant Behavior Questionnaire (IBQ) for age 3-12 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Using the Early Childhood Behavioral Questionnaire (ECBQ) for age 13 - 36 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep quality, duration and efficiency (total sleep time / duration of sleep episode *100) computed using the Brief Infant Sleep Questionnaire (BISQ). In addition, an actigraphy in combination with a sleep diary will be used during home period and their relationship will indicate the sleep quality

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured via the shotgun metagenomics sequencing for species composition and functional pathways through stool samples collected

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Breast milk composition (lipids, carbohydrates, proteins, minerals and vitamins) will be measured by the MIRIS analyzer through breast milk samples collected (only for breast-fed subjects)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Using validated Child Feeding Practice Questionnaire. In addition, to complete the feeding and adverse events calendar monthly during home period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Using the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version (BRIEF-P) and the Dimensional Change Card Sort (DCCS) task

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: Weight in grams and corresponding weight-for-age Z-score according to the WHO growth standards

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: Length in centimeters and corresponding length-for-age Z-score according to the WHO growth standards

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: Corresponding weight-for-length Z-score according to the WHO growth standards

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: Head circumference in centimeters and corresponding head-circumference-for-age Z-score according to the WHO growth standards

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: Weight and height will be combined to report the BMI (kg/m2) and corresponding BMI-for-age Z-score according to the WHO growth standards

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: using validated Infant Gastrointestinal Symptom Questionnaire (IGSQ) for age 1.5-12 months

other_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 8 month after baseline
other_outcome.description: using the Toddler Gut Comfort Questionnaire (TGCQ) for age 12-24 months

other_outcome.measure: Adverse Events (e.g., type, incidence, severity, seriousness)
other_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment until 36 months of age

arm_group.description: aged from 1.5-6 months. Includes predominantly breastfed infants and formula-fed infants. This is an observational trial so no intervention will be provided, with exception of study assessments, including MRI.

aged from 9-15 months. Includes follow-up formula-fed / growing-up milk-fed infants & toddlers. This is an observational trial so no intervention will be provided, with exception of study assessments, including MRI.

intervention.description: MRI is a safe, non-invasive, cutting edge imaging technology widely used to study the human brain both internationally (NIH connectome project) and in China (China Brain Project). The Baby Connectome Project (BCP) led by NIH scientists has begun data collection on the structural and functional brain development among American infants (Howell, Styner et al. 2019).

study_pop.textblock:
Healthy normal developing Chinese infants and toddlers; minimum number of subjects with successful MRI scans required: N=70
- Sub-cohort 1 (N=40): including predominantly breastfed infants (n=15) and formula-fed infants (n=25)
- Sub-cohort 2 (N=30): including 30 follow-up formula-fed / growing-up milk-fed infants & toddlers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Full-term (more than 37 weeks and >2.5kg)
2. Children aged between 1.5-6 months (42-182 days) or 9-15 months (274-456 days) at enrolment.
3. Normally developing infants and toddlers as assessed by clinician.
4. No major risk factors for learning, neurologic, or psychiatric disorder as assessed by clinician.
5. Baseline dietary pattern in the past 60 days and intention to continue current dietary pattern during course of the study in one of three groups below:
I. Predominantly breast-fed group II. Predominantly infant formula-fed group III. Follow-Up Formula / Growing Up Milk-fed group
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of diagnosed neurological (e.g., head injury, epilepsy), psychiatric or developmental disorder in parents or siblings, as assessed by clinician.
2. In-utero exposure to alcohol abuse or illicit substances as defined as diagnosis of current substance use disorder in the biological mother and guidelines set by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists and the Royal College of Physicians.
3. Multiple birth as reported in medical record.
4. Abnormalities on fetal ultrasound as reported in the medical record (outpatient obstetrics medical records).
5. Complicated pregnancy (e.g., preeclampsia, gestational diabetes) as assessed by medical interview/ medical record.
6. Neonatal intensive care unit admission (>24h) and/or emergency surgical delivery as reported in medical record.
7. Abnormal screening laboratory values and studies considered to be clinically significant in the opinion of the Investigator (e.g., metabolic disease screening, neonatal bilirubin).
